name: CellRendererToggle

signals.name: toggled
signals.description: The ::toggled signal is emitted when the cell is toggled.

methods.name: Gtk.CellRendererToggle()
methods.description:
Creates a new #GtkCellRendererToggle. Adjust rendering
parameters using object properties. Object properties can be set
globally (with g_object_set()). Also, with #GtkTreeViewColumn, you
can bind a property to a value in a #GtkTreeModel. For example, you
can bind the "active" property on the cell renderer to a boolean value
in the model, thus causing the check button to reflect the state of
the model.

returns.description: %TRUE if the cell renderer is activatable.

methods.name: get_activatable
methods.description:
Returns whether the cell renderer is activatable. See
gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_set_activatable().

returns.description: %TRUE if the cell renderer is active.

methods.name: get_active
methods.description:
Returns whether the cell renderer is active. See
gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_set_active().

returns.description: %TRUE if we're rendering radio toggles rather than checkboxes

methods.name: get_radio
methods.description: Returns whether we're rendering radio toggles rather than checkboxes.

methods.name: set_active
methods.description: Activates or deactivates a cell renderer.

methods.name: set_radio

parameters.name: radio
parameters.description: %TRUE to make the toggle look like a radio button

methods.description:
If @radio is %TRUE, the cell renderer renders a radio toggle
(i.e. a toggle in a group of mutually-exclusive toggles).
If %FALSE, it renders a check toggle (a standalone boolean option).
This can be set globally for the cell renderer, or changed just
before rendering each cell in the model (for #GtkTreeView, you set
up a per-row setting using #GtkTreeViewColumn to associate model
columns with cell renderer properties).

description:
#GtkCellRendererToggle renders a toggle button in a cell. The
button is drawn as a radio or a checkbutton, depending on the
#GtkCellRendererToggle:radio property.
When activated, it emits the #GtkCellRendererToggle::toggled signal.
